New Records: Shota Imanaga pitched 6 innings with 4 hits, 3 ER, and 8 K for the Cubs.
Jake Irvin pitched 4.2 innings with 8 hits, 7 ER, and 6 K for the Nationals.
Key Match Events: Cody Bellinger hit a solo home run in the 2nd inning to cap a 7-run inning for the Cubs.
The Nationals scored 6 runs in the 9th inning, including a two-run single by Jose Vargas and a two-run double by Alex Young.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs entered the game with a 69-66 record and were 33-37 on the road.
The Nationals had a 61-74 record and were 32-35 at home.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs won the series opener and extended their winning streak to 3-0 in the series.
The Nationals struggled offensively, only scoring 6 runs in total.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Nationals Park in Washington, D.C., with 28,792 attendees.
The game lasted 2 hours and 39 minutes.
Others: The Cubs' bullpen pitched 3.1 innings without allowing a run, including a save by Kolby Thompson.
